: : Darkangel : :

Darkangel: I was afraid of that. I believe you though. I guess you should no where you are. This is the planet earth, back in prehistoric times. Three cybertronian transformer factions are currently engaged in a war we call the Neo Beast Wars.


Nic <Proudwing500k@...> wrote:
All that summary of events sincerely shocked Bloodblade. How could he 
have survived that kind of ordeal?

Bloodblade: I... Actually, I can't tell you. I don't even remember 
myself.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> : : Darkangel : :
> 
> Darkangel eased up a bit. He crossed his hands behind his back and 
slowy paced in front of the bot.
> 
> Darkangel: Well, Bloodblade, you managed to come through the 
atmosphere of this planet without any form of protection and survive. 
Now I'm sure you can realize how odd this is. These are dire times 
and we must be sure of those who walk among us.
> 
> Angel stops pacing, facing Bloodblade once again.
> 
> Darkangel: You seem very confused. Can you tell me where you came 
from and what your purpose is?
> 
> 
> Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> Bloodblade tried to focus. His sensors were still uncalibrated and 
he 
> barely understood the statement. Custody? He had to process a lot 
to 
> grasp the meaning, but then he wondered. In the custody of whom, 
and 
> why?
> 
> He took a moment before answering, proceeding through a rapid setup 
> that would allow him to function a bit on the language and 
cognitive 
> circuits.
> 
> Bloodblade: I am Bloodblade... Who are you? What did I do to 
deserve 
> your custody? I hope I did nothing to dire...
> 
> Tyrael was amazed at just how confused this bot was. Somehow, he 
knew 
> who he was, but it seemed like the rest of his hard drive had 
been... 
> deleted... Who could have done that? Yet, his answer seemed all the 
> more sincere.
> 
> He watched and waited for Darkangel to continue.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
wrote:
> > : : Darkangel : :
> > 
> > Darkangel looked Bloodblade square in the optics.
> > 
> > Darkangel: That's a question I should be asking you, stranger. 
You 
> are in my custody. Now, identify yourself!
> > 
> > 
> > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > Bloodblade was still in a deep daze. He was not fully conscious 
of 
> > his surroundings, but he was in bot mode.
> > 
> > Tyrael marvelled at this stranger's design. Sleek, yet robust, it 
> > seemed to belie some sort of hidden secret.
> > 
> > Tyrael: Peculiar one, that is for sure. Darkangel, you take the 
> lead 
> > of the interrogation. I'll assist you, but you're in charge.
> > 
> > The crimson and silver bot shook slightly, as if trying to grasp 
> what 
> > was going on. He knew by his internal computer that his damages 
had 
> > only been slightly repaired, but he could not remember anything 
of 
> > how he got damaged this bad.
> > 
> > Bloodblade: W... who..?
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> wrote:
> > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > 
> > > Darkangel: Aye. Follow me, we can take care of this now.
> > > 
> > > Darkangel leads Tyrael towards the CR room.
> > > 
> > > Once there, Darkangel raises the platform out of the CR tank so 
> > that the unkown bot was suspended apove the tank. Angel then 
> > constructs a force field around him so he cant escape.
> > > 
> > > Darkangel: Wake up.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > Tyrael: He came down without any protective gear? How did he 
even 
> > > survive the entry?!?
> > > 
> > > He shuts up for a moment, then realizes something else.
> > > 
> > > Tyrael: What was a lone bot doing orbiting the planet, then 
> > entering 
> > > the atmosphere and surviving? If he wasn't alone, then who was 
> with 
> > > him? I don't like it at all. Take him out of there, we'll 
> > interrogate 
> > > him.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> 
> > wrote:
> > > > : : DeathStar/Darkangel : :
> > > > 
> > > > DeathStar: Right away, sir. Flight mode!
> > > > 
> > > > Once again DeathStar flew away from the Tripredacus base, 
this 
> > time 
> > > heading for Maximal territory.
> > > > 
> > > > Darkangel took this time to converse with his superior.
> > > > 
> > > > Darkangel: Not yet. I saw him touch down on my way back. 
There 
> > was 
> > > no ship. Just his exo-structure took him through the 
atmosphere. 
> > > Somehow he survived. As you could imagine, his injuries are 
quite 
> > > severe. He'll need extensive CR time.
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > Tyrael was surprised.
> > > > 
> > > > Tyrael: Destroyed? The two of them? By the Ancestors, Unicron 
> > will 
> > > be 
> > > > so mad! We've got to finish the gun before he comes. 
Deathstar, 
> > go 
> > > > fetch someone from Maximal base to help you and Dreadplague 
> build 
> > > it. 
> > > > Go.
> > > > 
> > > > He thought for a moment, frowning.
> > > > 
> > > > Tyrael: What about your newfound bot, Darkangel? Have you had 
> > time 
> > > to 
> > > > analyze him or learn anything about him?
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
<roborick007@y...> 
> > > wrote:
> > > > > : : Darkangel/DeathStar : :
> > > > > 
> > > > > Darkangel returned to the base with the bot he found. He 
> placed 
> > > the 
> > > > bot in a CR tank. He would check on him in a while.
> > > > > 
> > > > > DeathStar also arrived back at base. Just before landing 
> there 
> > > had 
> > > > been traces of an incoming comm message but the jammers were 
> > still 
> > > in 
> > > > place.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Both bots arrive at Tyrael's location.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Darkangel: Darkangel, reporting. The Maximals have defended 
> > > > themselves. Unicron's minions have been destroyed. Rodimus 
has 
> > > agreed 
> > > > to the alliance. They are preparing. Also, I dound a crashed 
> bot 
> > on 
> > > > the way back. He is currently in the CR tank.
> > > > > 
> > > > > DeathStar: The platform for the weapon has been 
constructed, 
> > sir.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Bloodblade weakly grumbled. What was incredible with him 
was 
> > > that, 
> > > > > after all the damage he'd taken, he was still not in stasis 
> > lock, 
> > > > > simply passed out.
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > wrote:
> > > > > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Darkangel finds Bloodblade and decides to take this bot 
> with 
> > > him. 
> > > > > Angel carefully picks up the injured bot and takes off, in 
> bot 
> > > > mode, 
> > > > > for the Tripred base.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Bloodblade had survived entry, but he was awfully 
damaged. 
> > His 
> > > > > armor 
> > > > > > was charred and stripped away at some places, and molten 
at 
> > > > others. 
> > > > > > He was in definite need for CR.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen 
> > <roborick007@y...> 
> > > > > wrote:
> > > > > > > : : Darkangel : :
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > While in flight, returning to the Tripredacus base, 
> > Darkangel 
> > > > saw 
> > > > > > Bloodblade come down. He alters course, landing at the 
> touch 
> > > down 
> > > > > > spot, in bot mode.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Darkangel: That looked like a bot that went down, not a 
> > ship. 
> > > > How 
> > > > > > could any being survive the atmospheric entry?
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Nic <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > > Bloodblade, orbiting Earth disguised as a pod, got a 
> > > > confirmation 
> > > > > > > that Rockseeker and Lunekill were both terminated. 
> > > Reluctantly, 
> > > > > he 
> > > > > > > decided to warn his Master.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Bloodblade: Master Unicron, Rockseeeker and Lunekill 
have 
> > > just 
> > > > > been 
> > > > > > > terminated.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > The response was immediate and terrible. He was 
attacked 
> > both 
> > > > in 
> > > > > > his 
> > > > > > > body and in his spark, even though his Lord was at the 
> > other 
> > > > end 
> > > > > of 
> > > > > > > the system. Tendrils of electricity shook him, causing 
> > > > > > interferences 
> > > > > > > that could be picked up from Earth.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > In the middle of his agony, he heard a thundrous voice 
> > inside 
> > > > his 
> > > > > > > head.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > Unicron: Incompetent Minions! They have failed me. Now, 
> > > > > Bloodblade, 
> > > > > > > it is your turn to go, but I have learned from this.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > When the pain stopped, he had forgotten who he was or 
who 
> > he 
> > > > > > served. 
> > > > > > > He only remembered his name. He started spinning wildly 
> as 
> > he 
> > > > > > entered 
> > > > > > > high orbit and was attracted to the ground.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > A few minutes later, he crashed loudly into the ground, 
> > > exactly 
> > > > > at 
> > > > > > > the same distance from the three bases.
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > >
